intro: Gonocaryum grandifolium, commonly known as the large-leafed gonocaryum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its botanical structure includes a woody stem with opposite leaf arrangement and small, elliptical leaves. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
